author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to block internal URLs that are deemed malicious or pose a threat to the organization's network. This includes configuring web filtering, firewalls, and other security appliances to effectively block access to these URLs. It is essential for preventing unauthorized access and mitigating potential attacks from within the organization.

fields.title: Internal URL
fields.description: The internal URL that can be blocked

fields.title: URL Category
fields.description: Category or type of the internal URL (application, service, resource)

fields.title: Block Method
fields.description: Method available to block the URL (web filter, proxy, firewall)

fields.title: Authentication Context
fields.description: Authentication requirements for the internal URL

fields.title: User Groups Affected
fields.description: User groups that would be affected by blocking the URL

fields.title: Service Dependencies
fields.description: Services or applications that depend on the URL

fields.title: Block Granularity
fields.description: Granularity of blocking (exact URL, pattern, domain-wide)

fields.title: Override Mechanism
fields.description: Available mechanism to override the block if needed

fields.title: Logging and Alerting
fields.description: Logging and alerting capabilities for block events

fields.title: Testing Procedure
fields.description: Procedure to test the URL block effectiveness

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: Establish Ability to Block Internal URLs

references.name: Network Security Controls and Traffic Filtering
NIST SP 800-41 Rev. 1: Guidelines for Firewall and Network Security
